page.title: 16Public Transport In Thorney
page.content: In Thorney the public transport is provided by{Cambus Ltd, National {Express,}and{Greens Falcon Coaches. The last of these has been established in the village since about{1920.}As well as providing daily bus services to Peterborough,{Greens}also bring children in from the fens to the school. They run three buses. Apart from the buses on the school run, all services run{east/west}along the main{A47.}It is possible to travel daily to{Wisbech, Norwich,}and {Hunstanton}to the east, and {Peterborough}to the west. In addition, at certain times of the year you can travel to{Birmingham, Blackpool, {Cromer, Gt.Yarmouth,}and{Nottingham. It is even possible to catch an overnight coach to{Aberdeen,}with a journey time of 16 hours! We are obviously far from being isolated!
